reviewText:
Another abomination dragged-and-dropped to life in the hideous GameGuru engine and spat out onto Steam like a lingering dangle of phlegm, Alone K.W. barely has the decency to even launch, let alone provide any measure of appealing gameplay.

The first loading screen lasted nearly four minutes for me and has apparently taken longer for some if it forgoes crashing after ten seconds. The game itself granted me a few minutes of actual playtime before refusing to let me interact with a keypad to progress. The flashlight battery change similarly refused to play ball, leaving me to poke the 'Use' key to no avail in the darkness while the game occasionally reminded me of the controls for fruitlessly pushing scenery crates around.

Isn't the point of GameGuru, an engine that mocks your attempts to implement your own scripts, that although any product that comes out of it will be an asset-drowned high school project at best, its sheer simplification of game creation is meant to be stable? This is about as solidly built as a gangrene sufferer and nowhere near as contagious.

Whatever pitiful moments of my life were taken by this disgrace are documented below.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=35aT2vSuHkc

reviewText: Absolutely terrible game". And I say "game" because it was created using Game Guru
date: a drag-and-drop game maker. I froze on the first loading screen and ended up having to use the .exe to even start playing. I was met with laughable level design
hoursPlayed: objects that glitched all over the place
voteText: a character who casually walks over EVERYTHING (including huge cabinets)
helpfulPercent:
and the silliest storyline imaginable. Thankfully it's all over with in just under 45 minutes.

Bottom line is this: Don't bother wasting your time or money. Just don't.

reviewText: The horror genre has reached a new low with this game. Everything, from the visuals, to the setting, the atmosphere, the story, is just awful. And I understand, that not everyone is a native english speaker, but for crying out loud, if you're going to release a game to an international audience, have your spelling and grammar checked by someone who speaks decent english. If this game were free, I'd still request a refund for it.
